Main Duties include:

  • Responsible for the day to day operations of the acceptance, treatment & disposal of Hazardous and
    non-hazardous waste.
  • Monthly reporting on progress with cell development, filling plans, storm water management
  • Collating statistics and compiling reports
  • Dealing with enquiries and complaints from members of the public
  • Investigating and following up claims of illegal dumping
  • Evaluate respective data, prepare proposals and reports, and take part in other environmental
    consulting projects.
  • Provide engineering analyses and calculation
  • Investigate and procure data required to develop a design
  • Utilize various engineering related computer software
  • Compile project specifications & Complete construction cost estimates
  • Actively manages and tracks capital budgets for engineering and construction projects and report to
    local management and corporate using Company procedures.
  • Ensure projects run smoothly and structures are completed within budget and on time.
  • Managing consultants, contractors and budgets, preparation of bid documents, bid letting, contract
    administration, coordinating contractors, construction quality assurance firms, and materials order and
    delivery.
    Criteria:
  • B-Tech/BSC Civil/Rural Engineering qualification
  • 3-5 year’s experience in: Earthworks, Waste/Landfill Management
  • Experience in managing plant and equipment specifically “yellow machines”
  • Excellent knowledge of design and visualizations software such as AutoCAD is essential
  • A knowledge of the field of geosynthetics would be an advantage
  • Must be able to communicate in isiZulu
  • Good reporting and presentation skills
  • An innovation mind-set and solutions driven approach
  • Ability to analyse and interpret data for modelling purposes
  • Knowledge of waste legislation would be an added advantage
  • Prepared to work additional hours as and when required
